Content: If multiple mods override the same method, and all do `super.ThatMethod();`, is the original `ThatMethod()` called multiple times?

Author: MaD#6270
Deleted User
Content: No only once. The super call just chain calls all the methods ThatMethod one after another. The order is dependant on mod load order. If one mod would not call super ThatMethod would not be called for each mod loaded after the respective mod not calling super

Author: Deleted User
Content: And would also result in the situation that the original ThatMethod would never be called. That's why super is so important to keep the logic of other mods intact. There only very rare cases where one would not want to call super

Author: jacob_mango
Content:
so a simulation tick is basically the `CommandHandler` function in the `Man`/`DayZCreature` classes, which `PlayerBase` inherits from.

a simulation tick can also refer to the `EOnSimulate` method.

You want to make sure that you are only calling that function once every time either of those functions are called and you want to make sure you aren't calling it in `DayZGame::OnUpdate` or `Mission'x'::OnUpdate` since those run every frame unless you are certain it will be called once in that simulation tick

Author: jacob_mango
Content: I'm only guessing that the issue is related to it being called once every simulation tick. Maybe it could only be called once every life, or you have to wait for the client. There could be many other factors at play that is causing this issue
